storyInfo: Doc heads to an impoverished Victorian village to deliver medicine but is mistaken by the local officials for a Gaulish restorationist. Unfortunately for him, they are not the only ones who have the wrong idea about his identity.

attributes.content: 'Thank you so much, Doctor. You saved Cuomo's life!'
'Make sure he stays in bed for two weeks. He needs proper rest to keep his illness from coming back. Keep an eye on him.'
'Of course! I will! How much do I pay you? How should I even pay you?'
'You don't have to pay.'
'That won't do! You're the first doctor who's come to this village in years!'
'You have nothing to feel bad about. I'm the one who should be ashamed of my comfortable situation, after seeing yours.'
'Then.. then we... we don't have any luxuries to offer, but at the very least... have a glass of water before you leave?'
'Merci.'
'What was that?'
'Sorry. I mean, 'thank you'.'
Any other documents to prove your identity?
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: Just these.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Then I can't let you enter Stonebreak Village. Your documents are insufficient.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: No one asked me for any identification papers the last time I went there. Your predecessor even contacted a convoy to escort me.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: He might have been passionate with his job, but I'm more responsible for my duty.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: Fine. Mind telling me what documents I'm missing? I can go and fetch them.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Doctor, I'm sure you know what I mean by 'insufficient documents'.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: All I know is that Stonebreak Village urgently needs me to deliver this medicine.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: The way I see it, you're a stranger with a gun on your hip and a foreign accent. This Victorian village does not need a man like you to save them. You should be getting home.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: I never claimed to be able to save the whole village. But I will try to save as many lives as I can.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Really? The 'lives' you wish to 'save' don't seem to think the same, Gaulish restorationist.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: Gaulish... what?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Quit playing doctor, instigator. You can't fool me with that Gaulish accent of yours.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: This is a misunderstanding.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: If that's the case, then why not Sandbar Village or Titenay Village? Why Stonebreak Village, the only Gaulish resettlement under my jurisdiction?
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: Because Sandbar Village already has a retired doctor.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Titenay Village even has a hospital that's still functioning, and the other villages have regular caravans passing through providing medical services...
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: But the doctor in Stonebreak passed a few years ago, and there is no one to fill the vacancy. That, alongside caravans refusing to pass through the place, makes it the only village without access to medical care under your jurisdiction.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Could it be... that you're really a spy who's been collecting intelligence?
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: Quite the opposite. Your predecessor shared a breakdown of the available medical services in the area before connecting me with an escort.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: I swear to you, I will do nothing in the village beyond the responsibilities of a physician.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Alright, that's enough hot air from you.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: You know, there was a time we had a simple test to root out your kind. We just had you spit on a portrait of Corsica I. Anyone who hesitated would be suspect.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: ...Corsica I? Is that a Gaulish emperor?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Who else? Why the dumbfounded face?
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: (shrug) I thought Corsica would be his birthplace rather than his regnal name.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Finally here in Stonebreak... it's been a difficult journey.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Abel, how are you? Are your asthma attacks still as frequent as before? And what about Cuomo—
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: It's the doctor! He really did come back, just like he said!
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: It really is him...
attributes.name: Amazed Villager

attributes.content: It's the doctor! He's back!
attributes.name: Excited Villager

attributes.content: Doctor, come over to my place!
attributes.name: Hospitable Villager

attributes.content: What for? We need to throw a welcome party for him!
attributes.name: Impetuous Villager

attributes.content: Let's get the medicine distributed first. The sooner I can get this to everyone, the sooner I can stop worrying.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: I brought a newly developed long-lasting inhibitor you only use once a month. This is a six-month supply, so please keep it safe.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Merci...
attributes.name: Pallid Infected

attributes.content: Apple for you, doctor. Please. You told me not to work so hard the last time you were here, so I just wandered around the village picking fruits and the like.
attributes.name: Kindly Old Woman

attributes.content: Make sure you get enough nutrition too—
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: You haven't changed a bit. So afraid to disturb our lives last time, only to leave the village in a body out of shape. I saw it... yes, just take it.
attributes.name: Kindly Old Woman

attributes.content: Your medicine!
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Merci.
attributes.name: Kindly Old Woman

attributes.content: Abel, why were you letting the others go ahead of you in the medicine queue?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: I just have asthma, but the others are old or chronically ill, and there's the Infected too, so I should let them go first.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: I have to thank you on their behalf. But didn't I talk to you about cutting down on smoking…
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: I've quit.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Good to hear. Here's the inhaler I mentioned before. Take it.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Merci.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: De rien——
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.text: 'Quit playing doctor, instigator. You can't fool me with that Gaulish accent of yours.'

attributes.content: No, you don't have to thank me.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: You must be thirsty, doctor. I'll wash you an apple.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: It's alright, I can do it myself—
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: No, please have a seat, I'll do it!
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Abel, I heard the doctor's here. Where is he?
attributes.name: Villager's Voice

attributes.content: Around the corner. He's handing out medicine right now. Hale and hearty as you are, you should probably come back later.
attributes.name: Abel's Voice

attributes.content: Merci.
attributes.name: Villager's Voice

attributes.content: De rien.
attributes.name: Abel's Voice

attributes.content: Is that Gaulish too? What do you mean?
attributes.name: Villager's Voice

attributes.content: 'No problem'. I learned it from the doctor just now.
attributes.name: Abel's Voice

attributes.content: De... rien...... Alright, I got it.
attributes.name: Villager's Voice

attributes.content: Your apple.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Abel... have you been teaching the French I taught you to the others?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: 'French'? Weren't you teaching me Gaulish?
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: It's been many years since we've spoken our mother tongue, so I passed on everything you taught me to the entire village. We're all grateful for the lessons... and we hope to learn even more from you.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: 'Merci.'
'What was that?'
'Sorry. I mean, 'thank you'.'
'Are you Gaulish?'
'Uh... I have a friend who has never been to Kazimierz, but she says that she would count as a Kazimierzian here. It's more or less the same with me.'
'So... you can speak Gaulish then?'
'Haha. If you could call me a Gaulishman, then I suppose my mother tongue counts as some sort of Gaulish.'
'Can you teach me a few phrases?'
Sorry to dash your hopes, but I've been teaching you French, not Gaulish.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Oh...? Well...
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Sorry for not explaining the difference beforehand. If you do want to learn a new language, I think it should be your own.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: I have to get going. I need to prepare for surgery.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Please wait! I'll help you!
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: How is it? Does your knee feel better?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Much better! I wouldn't dare imagine a day like this without you around... I know how you cured the others in even worse shape!
attributes.name: Kindly Old Woman

attributes.content: You're incredible. You're our savior...
attributes.name: Kindly Old Woman

attributes.content: ...Savior?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Please don't get the wrong idea. I merely flushed out the excess fluid in your joints, but your arthritis is still quite severe, so you must avoid any hard work and cut down on your walks—
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Yes, yes, I understand! Take good care of myself, and these old knees will improve too, yes! Thank you so much! Merci, merci! You are truly our savior!
attributes.name: Kindly Old Woman

attributes.content: I'll follow you to the end with these old legs of mine!
attributes.name: Kindly Old Woman

attributes.content: No, you've got the wrong idea! Please, wait—
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Did that old lady leave something behind?
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Abel, please go and tell her. At best, her knees will no longer deteriorate, but she shouldn't get her hopes up.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Forget that. She's in quite a sorry shape, actually. She's so old that she can't even have a proper meal without help.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Wasn't she picking apples around the village?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: I'll let you in on something. Old man Victor over at the orchard took pity on her and left some damaged apples on the paths she always takes to make her happy.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: ...Does she know?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: She's been more active outside the village ever since she picked those apples.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: This won't do. Her arthritis will only worsen this way—
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Then what do you suggest? Didn't you treat a bunch of people like her? Did all of them get the same advice to take less walks?
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: It doesn't matter if she can manage it for now, we have face reality at the very least.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: But the reality is that we basically live in subhuman conditions out here.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: The reason you refused to teach us more Gaulish was to protect us, right? That rest of the village might turn on us, everyone knows that...
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: It wasn't to protect—
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Although, they don't even need to do anything to us in the first place.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: My father's generation had no choice when they came here. All the fertile land was already owned by someone else, and the 'Gaulish settlers' could only build their village on top of rubble and debris.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: The soil here is barren, and what we produce is only just enough to feed ourselves. That's why the trade caravans will never come through, and neither do the doctors.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: A few years ago, there was even talk of a road to be built between the villages, and of course, ours would inevitably be the last to be connected. But when there were just two villages left, they stopped all roadwork, saying it was too dangerous to continue in the face of an incoming Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: In the end, the Catastrophe never came, and the other village forked out their own money to finish the road to their village, but us...?
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: We're immediately put under suspicion even if the source of the trouble comes from some nomadic city. They say it's not because we're Gaulish, but it's to 'track down rogues' and 'strengthen security'...
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: We've been suffering all this time, until you came.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: You're... here to take us away from this place, aren't you? It's not just about treatment.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Slow down, Abel. What are you getting at? When did I ever say anything like that?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: The letter from your friend. It came from Leithanien.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: I'm so sorry that I looked through your bag, but... we can't go on like this any longer.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Come to your senses, Abel! This letter is written in Eng—Victorian! I'm sure you can see this is just a message from a friend!
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: But didn't this Monsieur 'Blitz' mention the overwhelming amount of suffering across the lands? He was talking about you looking to find a way home?
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: I remember a rumor from my early years, of some 'Kurfürsten' treating Gaulish remnants favorably—
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Abel! Look at me! What am I?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: A... doctor?
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Yes, a doctor. Nothing more.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: I came here to alleviate your suffering to the best of my abilities, not to numb you to the reality of the situation. Come to your senses.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: A deteriorated joint won't recover on a fantasy. I'm not a miracle worker. I can only do so much.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Taking us away from here is definitely something you could do! You managed to outsmart those officers, so you can certainly free us from this prison of stone and salt!
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: You're more than just a doctor! You're not the first doctor we've seen. Just what kind of doctor would heal so many people and refuse to take even a coin in return?
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Come with me. I have something that'll certainly surprise you.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: What's that...?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: A portrait of His Majesty Corsica I. We found this in the depths of some deaf old man's warehouse.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: It was defaced soon after His Majesty's demise. The old man couldn't recall his appearance, so we could only try our best to restore the painting...
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: It might not look like His Majesty, but everyone feels it's enough. He is the savior of the Gaulish after all...
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.text: Savior of the Gaulish?!
The face in the painting already made my jaw drop before I could even react to what that meant.

I can see the heavy damage inflicted on the face, and whoever did the restoration work could only fill in the gaps to the best of their imaginations, and the resulting face does strike a startling resemblance to a certain someone...
Myself.
The faded gold frame surrounds a Gustave Kateb in formal attire with a crown on his head and a sash draped over his chest.
If we were somewhere else, like on Earth, or Rhodes Island, or even Dossoles, this painting would be a comedic sight to behold.
But it just has to be lying right here.

attributes.content: I'm sorry, but I don't want to look at this any longer. You should lock it back up.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: I'm no savior of the Gaulish.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Why come to Stonebreak, a place as destitute and desolate as ours, if not to save us?!
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: I help people tormented by illness, no matter what language they speak, or where they come from.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: My next destination is not even Leithanien, but Kazdel. Because I hear the people over there also suffering.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: The devils?! No... no way... you can't!
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: I also promised the Victorian official earlier that I would not do anything outside the scope of a doctor's work.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: You said that just to get in here! That must be it!
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: On the contrary, I intend to keep my promise.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.text: After our conversation, the portrait is locked away deep in the warehouse. I try to minimize any small talk with the villagers, but their eyes are still full of veneration, and it only grows more intense with each passing day.
I don't know who exactly they hold in high esteem—a doctor, or a 'savior of the Gaulish'.
I had no choice but to stuff my schedule with surgeries and consultations, hoping that being an idol unresponsive to any prayer would bring them back to reality.
As it turns out, I was dead wrong.

attributes.content: Abel?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Business at the village gates?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: No, it's nothing.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: In that case, take this medicine.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Didn't you already give me an inhaler?
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: I've been so busy the whole time I forgot about that Cuomo of yours.  Here's his medicine. Don't forget to give it to him when he's back. He still needs to recuperate for a while more—
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Abel...?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: It wasn't even two whole days after you left the last time that they sent a dispatch here looking for rogues and it kept us up all night. They chased Cuomo out of bed on the pretense of a contraband check.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: And then... Cuomo suffered another coughing fit. I begged them to help me take Cuomo into town, but they... wouldn't even answer me.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: I went to another village that night looking for help, but we have no money, so no one was willing to come. In the end, we managed with much difficulty to convince that old doctor from Sandbar to come, but by then...
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: I quit smoking the next day.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Doctor, things are different this time, aren't they? You won't abandon us like the last time?
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: We all know that no one would be willing to so much as bat an eye towards us, except for another Gaulishman.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: You've healed us all, so you'll save us all in the end, this I know, I know for sure...
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Wait, Abel. What's that in your hand?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: An announcement. Telling everyone to leave this village and head for Leithanien. Telling everyone you'll overcome all our obstacles, that you'll bring us to somewhere we can live in peace and joy...
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Save me... Save us all...
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: *Cough*, *cough* *cough*... *Cough*!
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: An asthma attack?!
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: I've put the mask on, Abel. Take deep breaths.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: (Gasping)
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Deep breaths!
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: (Rough gasping)
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Listen to me. Breathe in on one, and out on two! One... two! One... two!
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: One... two... one... two...
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: (Breathing gradually improves)
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: (Mumbling)
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Don't speak—
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Everyone's... here...
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Listen, I no longer have any business here in Stonebreak Village. I should go.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: We'll go with you, we need you to show us the way.
attributes.name: Kindly Old Woman

attributes.content: I'm a doctor, not a shepherd.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: But I... my children... we're alive thanks to you.
attributes.name: Grateful Villager

attributes.content: I didn't save your lives for myself.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: If the Victorians won't let us leave, if they harm even a single hair on your head, I'll fight them until I breathe my last.
attributes.name: Pallid Infected

attributes.content: If that's the case, then I wish I hadn't come here at all.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: You saved us.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: I only treated your sicknesses. I cannot save anyone.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: You can.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: After all... you're the savior of the Gaulish.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.text: I don't know who put it in his hands, but Abel is once again holding the painting. The portrait of Gustave Kateb dressed like Corsica I.
Everyone gazes at me with the same look in their eyes. I've seen the same expression before, but back then, it wasn't directed towards me.
An expression full of anguish, reverence, brimming with hope... and delusions.
I smell the scent of blood yet to spill.

attributes.content: ...Abel. Perfect timing, I have something I need of you before I leave.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Of course, everyone here is at your beck and call.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Take this.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: A book?
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: All of your medical records are in here. I color-coded them according to the severity of your illnesses. I've included at the end of every record a note on how to treat your conditions, and the prescribed dosage of each medication.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: You've already healed us, we don't need this anymore.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: My power has limits. There are only a number of ailments I can actually cure. Delusions alone cannot protect you; this illness will resurface soon.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: That old lady has already begun suffering pain in her legs, right?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Right, take this, and... give me the portrait.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Give me the portrait.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: ...As you wish.
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.text: I scrutinize the portrait again.
If the Gustave Kateb here wasn't wearing the garb of Corsica I, then perhaps I would have brought it back to Rhodes Island as an amusing anecdote to share.
But no.
I'm a doctor. I know what it means, to give a patient an impractical fantasy.
I am already swallowing the bitter pill of my own unintended making.
I hold the portrait with one hand, and fish out my revolver with the other.
The crowd can clearly tell what I intend to do, but no one moves, like devotees awaiting a final judgement.
They stare at me dead in the face, the delusions in their eyes flickering like freshly ignited candlelight.
It burns out when the revolver goes off, and there is not even condemnation or loathing left, but only disillusionment.
I won't call this 'a good thing,' but snapping them out of their fantasies is better than spilling blood.
I turn the portrait so it faces me. I have to thank the Rhodes Island Engineering Department for their industrial keton. Apart from the face, the rest of the painting is practically unscathed.

attributes.content: Take it, Abel.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Take... what?
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: The portrait.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: What... even for? What use is... a ruined portrait?
attributes.name: Abel

attributes.content: Give this portrait its rightful face, or at the very least, don't ever again paint a doctor's face over an emperor's.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: If Corsica I's appearance has already been lost to time, then go find someone else who is truly able to save you, someone who can take you away from the stone and salt.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Perhaps he can speak real Gaulish, or maybe he can't. He might take you down a path of peace, or destruction.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Perhaps he is here in your crowd. Perhaps he's every one of you.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: But he is not me.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: A doctor will fight for his patient, but his patients are human, and not... some human construct.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Sorry.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Je suis navré.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.text: Abel takes the portrait with confusion all over his face, as whispering is heard from the crowd.
I don't know if they understood my intentions, but I can definitely see that they haven't turned a deaf ear to my words.
The most arduous step has been taken, and they will begin to think, to reflect on themselves.
I hope their reflection won't come too late.

attributes.content: My good sir, I take back my previous insult, you are a true patriot—uh, no, a true pacifist.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: You know what transpired then?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Of course! Gosh, the level of anxiety I was on yesterday! I thought you were really going to bring those Gaulishmen to Leithanien!
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: What would you do, had I really done so?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: It would only prove how right we were to check for runaway rogues.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: There's still some time before the convoy arrives. Fancy a cup of tea?
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: No need.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: I have to say though, your final words to them were a little... dangerous. You should exercise more restraint in future.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: Restraint? Let me ask you. Are there any heavy alcoholics in town?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Well... of course... and a few of them at that, but what does this have to do with that?
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: May I ask which of these two methods are more restrained to you, then: To hope that they turn around before they drink themselves to death, or to let them drown their sorrows in drink because they have no other option?
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Sir... my previous words were spoken out of respect, so I hope you don't get the wrong idea.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: Certainly. My words at Stonebreak Village came from my responsibility as a doctor. That includes what I've just said to you. The same applies here.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: Then should I say to you 'I'll abide by the doctor's orders'?
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: I hope you will.
attributes.name: Doc

attributes.content: It's a shame that I feel no need to take a doctor's advice seriously.
attributes.name: Local Official

attributes.content: Certainly. You're not the only one. I hope you don't end up needing a doctor's services.
attributes.name: Doc
